cited_protocols.title: VU TIS Multimodal Molecular Imaging Pipeline for KPMP Biopsy Interrogation
VU TIS Multimodal Molecular Imaging Pipeline for KPMP Biopsy Interrogation

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2bbkv","text":"This protocol provides an overview of the Multimodal Molecular Imaging pipeline used by the Vanderbilt University Tissue Interrogation Site (VU TIS) as part of the Kidney Precision Medicine Project (KPMP). Individual protocols are contextualized within our larger workflow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: VU Biomolecular Multimodal Imaging Center / Spraggins Research Group

references.title: Autofluorescence microscopy as a label-free tool for renal histology and glomerular segmentation
references.authors: Patterson NH, Neumann EK, Sharman K, Allen J, Harris R, Fogo AB, De Caestecker M, Caprioli RM, Van de Plas R, Spraggins JM

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working
